intro: Verbesina schaffneri, commonly known as Schaffner's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features tall, erect stems and produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Verbesina schaffneri is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
